p: S. khuzistanica has a strong fragrance and is a popular herb in parts of Iran where it is used by native populations as a herbal tea and in folk medicine for its analgesic and antiseptic properties. More recent biological activities reported for S. khuzistanica include antiviral, antibacterial, antifungal, antispasmodic and antidiarrhea or vasodilatory properties [ 117, 118, 119, 120].
